knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

```{r}

# Read the training data that has all 1s
#BSData <- read.csv(file="partitioned/train_yes.csv", header=FALSE, sep=",")

BSData <- data.frame()

for(i in 0:368){
  tmp <- read.csv(file= sprintf("partitioned/train_%s.csv", i), header=FALSE, sep=",")
  tmp <- tmp[sample(nrow(tmp)), ] 
  tmp <- tmp[sample(1000), ]
  BSData <- rbind(BSData, tmp) 
}

```

```{r}
write.csv(BSData, file = "zerobs_0.csv",row.names=FALSE, col.names = FALSE)

```
